summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document outlines the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, facilitating the grooming and abuse, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release announcing the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in the abuse.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Made a statement in the press release praising the victims' bravery and condemning Maxwell's and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement in the press release commending investigators and expressing commitment to justice for survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's abuse of minors and, in some cases, participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and a federal indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein and with perjury.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Period
events.description: The period during which Maxwell and Epstein are alleged to have conspired to groom and sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse scheme operated from at least 1994 to 1997, targeting girls as young as 14.
Maxwell is accused of playing a critical role in grooming victims by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual interactions with Epstein.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell is also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions.
